title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The fuel tax rates specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to be 4.3 cents per gallon for certain periods. The fuel tax rates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to be 4.3 cents per gallon for specific periods, including after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended ticket taxes and transferred funds to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 30, 1997. Fund financing rate shall be zero for certain taxes imposed before specific dates, and a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held before a tax-increase date. On a tax-increase date, a person holding aviation fuel is liable for the tax imposed, to be paid as prescribed by the Secretary by the first day of the 7th month after the date. The term "tax-increase date" refers to the date 7 calendar days after specific dates. On a tax-increase date, aviation fuel held by a person is subject to a tax, to be paid by the first day of the 7th month after the date. The term "tax-increase date" refers to a date 7 calendar days after specific dates. The tax does not apply to aviation fuel held exclusively for certain uses. On the tax-increase date, no tax is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons, and the necessary information is submitted to the Secretary. On the tax-increase date, fuel exempt from tax is not counted if held by a person due to certain exemptions. Controlled groups are treated as one group, defined by the Code with a substitution for "more than 50 percent." On the tax-increase date, fuel exempt from tax is not counted if held by a person due to certain exemptions. Controlled groups are treated as one group, with a substitution for "more than 50 percent" instead of "at least 80 percent" in certain cases. Other laws applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code also apply, with penalties as necessary. The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. The amendment in Section 3 of the Code states that any tax amount received in the Treasury after specific dates shall be treated as received the day before such date, regardless of when it was actually received. This amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
